image.altText: Dr Alan Richardson

props.synopsis: Rural generalists are GPs with training in emergency care and one other advanced skill area. While Tasmania has a training program for rural generalists, doctors say their skills are not properly recognised by the Tasmanian Health Service.

title.children: GPs who want to stay in Tasmania say there are no jobs for their skills

image.altText: A graphic of a magnifying glass and a box filled with office supplies. The box has the Tasmanian Government logo on it.

props.synopsis: Seven years after allegations were made against a practitioner who was allegedly misusing public resources, Tasmania's Integrity Commission has finalised its investigation into the matter. However, the report has not been released to the public.

title.children: Tasmania's integrity body finishes 2019 probe but report still secret

image.altText: A teenage boy pats a fluffy wombat in a grassy area with spots of snow.

props.synopsis: Tom French's agoraphobia meant he couldn't leave the house to access the mental health care he needed, but a Hospital in the Home program means the care is coming to him.

title.children: Tom went from 'nature lover' to agoraphobia, but now he's getting help

image.altText: An old man with a mask and scarf, two young women and another gentlemen with a face covering walk into a court building.

props.synopsis: After former teacher Keith Athol Bates-Willie was found guilty of assault against Hobart schoolboys, 10 complainants read out in court their victim impact statements as sentencing begins.

title.children: 'He robbed me': Victim-survivors of Hobart teacher speak out

image.altText: Interior gallery with wooden floor and white wall with large textile work in shape of Tasmania in floral stitched fabric.

props.synopsis: "Dangerously low" arts sector funding has rendered the Tasmanian industry "highly vulnerable", with funding stagnant since 2016-17, the state government has conceded.

title.children: 'Major reputational risk': Briefing gives warning to Tasmanian arts minister

image.altText: A man in military uniform, aiming a weapon, seen from side on.

props.synopsis: Blasted into the bedrock, deep below the streets of Helsinki, these massive bunkers are currently used for recreation. Their primary function, however, is much more sinister: preparing for a Russian invasion.

title.children: Finland has a message for Vladimir Putin: We're ready

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with a smiling Donald Trump

props.synopsis: As other world leaders have discovered, a visit to Donald Trump's White House can become an unpredictable, if not uncomfortable, encounter.

title.children: The PM is set to sit down with Trump. What can he learn from other leaders?

image.altText: Barnaby Joyce in corridor net zero

props.synopsis: In declaring he won't be recontesting his lower house seat and letting speculation run that he might jump ship for One Nation, Barnaby Joyce is declaring he's had enough with the Nationals under David Littleproud.

title.children: Nobody puts Barnaby in a corner: Why the Nats need to monitor his next move

image.altText: A big underground playgrund.

props.synopsis: This designer's "risky playgrounds" are often divisive. His latest is four storeys underground in a former World War II oil tank.

title.children: Controversial or cool? The engineer causing a storm with his playgrounds

image.altText: A silhoutte of working dogs on a quad bike.

props.synopsis: Hot nights coupled with high daytime temperatures could see Australia heading into an extremely hot summer, BOM's first long-range forecast indicates.

title.children: Hot summer on the cards as BOM gives first sneak peek into season

image.altText: ange postecoglou waves his hands in the air wearing a nottingham forest jacket

props.synopsis: Nottingham Forest sacked the winless manager moments after their 3-0 defeat by Chelsea on Saturday local time, which left the club 17th in the standings and on the brink of slipping into the relegation zone.

title.children: Ange Postecoglou sacked by Nottingham Forest after eight games

image.altText: Oscar Piastri crashes into Lando Norris

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris have once again made contact with each other in a Formula 1 race, this time taking each other out at the sprint race of the US Grand Prix, just two weeks after their collision in Singapore.

title.children: 'It was more on Oscar': Sprint crash adds another twist to F1 title race

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne and Mitch Swepson celebrate

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne's magical early season form continues with the bat, Scott Boland and a pair of spinners offer a reminder of their skill, while Sam Konstas turns on the flair at round two of the Sheffield Shield.

title.children: Quick hits: Send-offs, spinners and more Marnus magic in the Shield

image.altText: Tourists sleep with their heads on a small table inside a McDonald's outlet.

props.synopsis: Young Chinese tourists with limited time and money are travelling 'special forces'-style — inspired by the efficiency, endurance, and intensity of military units.

title.children: Chinese tourists sleep in fast food outlet to save on accommodation

image.altText: A mussel with red tendrils on a coconut fibre mat

props.synopsis: Victor Harbor was one of the first areas affected by SA's harmful algal bloom. Now its citizens are funding and supporting research into rebuilding native mussel populations as it looks to the future.

title.children: South Australia plans mussel recovery after algal bloom crisis

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit and tie with his arms crossed. He stares at the camera. The Hard Quiz Kids logo is in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Hard Quiz Kids is here again, and we're gifting you a bunch of straightforward questions. Don't embarrass yourself.

title.children: Put your thinking cap on. It's time to play, HARD!

image.altText: Steve Waugh smiles, sitting in a room with lots of windows behind him.

props.synopsis: When Steve Waugh retired from cricket, he knew he wanted to use his influence to make a difference. It was meeting Mother Teresa that made him realise his new path.

title.children: The powerful encounter that set Steve Waugh on a path to philanthropy

image.altText: A older well dressed couple smile and pose for camera outside an old house.

props.synopsis: Classical musicians Richard and Suzy Miller count their circa-1832 home as one of their greatest creative achievements as they prepare to leave it for someone else to love.

title.children: Couple shuns 'restoration' to let historic home's past live on

image.altText: Julian Assange stands on the balcony of Ecuador's embassy in 2017.

props.synopsis: His lawyers suggested the jail term for David Morales, accused of discovery and disclosure of secrets, bribery, money laundering and illegal possession of weapons.

title.children: Assange wants man who spied on him in Ecuador embassy jailed for 20 years

image.altText: solar panels on an outback farm

props.synopsis: Australia's renewable energy push has resulted in a surge in household solar power. But what does that mean for private solar farms?

title.children: How cheap, widespread power from the sun could overshadow solar farms

image.altText: an artwork depicting Sydney’s queer history on the wall at Surry Hills Police Station

props.synopsis: The artwork, Queer Sydney: A History, was hung at Surry Hills Police Station, metres from where the annual Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras parade is held.

title.children: Queer Sydney mural removed from police station just days after going up

image.altText: A graphic image which says Gellung Warl

props.synopsis: Victoria's first Treaty with First Peoples' was debated in state parliament last week. The Treaty introduces some Victorian Aboriginal words you may not have heard before — here's how to say them and what they mean.

title.children: Gellung Warl and other Victorian Aboriginal words part of Australia's first Treaty

image.altText: A yellow bird with blue and red features, perched on a wattle tree.

props.synopsis: A primary school teacher is getting her students involved in a volunteer-led bird count, to gather a snapshot of birds across the country.

title.children: Bird-lovers help count species across Australia in annual bird count

image.altText: Snake bite victim Tristian Frahm holding a puppy

props.synopsis: The death of an 11-year-old Queensland boy from a snakebite may have been prevented had he received early medical attention, according to the findings of an inquest.

title.children: Coroner finds snakebite death of 11yo boy preventable

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt with grey hair

props.synopsis: Eliyahu Margalit's body was found after two bulldozers ploughed up pits in the earth in the city of Khan Younis.

title.children: Israel identifies remains of 10th hostage handed over by Hamas

image.altText: Jamie Melham holds aloft the Caulfield Cup after riding Half Yours to victory.

props.synopsis: Jamie Melham breaks new ground as the first female jockey to win the Caulfield Cup in its 149-year history, steering favourite Half Yours to victory in the $5 million handicap.

title.children: Melham creates Caulfield Cup history after riding Half Yours to victory

image.altText: A white man in police uniform standing next to a white woman to his right, wearing navy blue dress, standing in front of mics

props.synopsis: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro says the Country Liberal Party's tough-on-crime approach "is working". But after two teens broke into a play centre and left a trail of destruction, operator Steve Mason is not convinced.

title.children: Business owner says he doesn't believe crime has gone down in the NT

image.altText: A man in a cape

props.synopsis: The third-born child of Queen Elizabeth II will still be referred to as a prince and is expected to continue living in his Windsor mansion.

title.children: The week started badly for Prince Andrew. Here's how it led to giving up his title

image.altText: A village in the desert.

props.synopsis: Since October 7, tensions have been rising between Palestinians and Israeli settlers in the Occupied Palestinian Territory.

title.children: The other conflict that's been flaring between Israelis and Palestinians

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu sits among a crowd of people at a memorial.

props.synopsis: As the dust settles on the ceasefire and hostage exchange deal, the question arises as to whether the partial resolution could deliver Benjamin Netanyahu a bounce in the polls.

title.children: Netanyahu isn't liked in Hostages Square, but what about broader Israel?

image.altText: China watchers say no sign to see Xi's retirement.

props.synopsis: A key meeting of the Chinese Communist Party Central Committee is expected to include a major shake-up of President Xi Jinping's inner circle.

title.children: CCP could be set for 'largest' shake-up in modern era

image.altText: Donald Trump in a dark suit, white shirt and red tie gesturing with his right hand while speaking at a presidential lectern

props.synopsis: The US military has launched six strikes on Venezuelan vessels the Trump administration claims were involved in drugs trafficking, and some are warning the intervention is threatening to spark an all-out war.

title.children: Trump's f-bomb comment amid threat of 'full-fledged war' in Venezuela

image.altText: Kim wears a cap and light off-white top and looks out a window inside a dark kitchen

props.synopsis: The NSW government says it should have taken allegations of wrongdoing by a male school staff member more seriously. That failure left those who reported it so isolated their mental health spiralled and never fully recovered.

title.children: A teacher's aide did something wrong. Those who reported him suffered

image.altText: George Santos in a blue suit and sweater wearing dark-rimmed glasses and sitting with his fingers pressed together

props.synopsis: George Santos, a former Republican Congressman who is serving more than seven years in a US prison, was charged with stealing from donors, fraud and lying to Congress.

title.children: Trump commutes fraud sentence of ex-Republican who stole 11 people's identities

image.altText: John Bolton looking to the right wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: John Bolton has become one of Donald Trump's most vocal critics after he was ousted from the US president's administration during his first term.

title.children: Former Trump adviser pleads not guilty to sharing classified information
